instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: 15" Mid-2009 MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Airport Install?
threads.message:
I have a MacBook that only has a Bluetooth card currently installed. The regular Airport card hookup on the motherboard is not soldered in. The customer wants to upgrade it with a wireless card. Has anyone here seen this before and was able to upgrade it? I could just solder the connector to the board, but I'm unsure if the other necessary circuitry is present. 

On a side note, I'm amazed that Apple had the nerve to omit a wireless card in a $1000+ laptop in 2009.

threads.title: 15" Mid-2009 MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Airport Install?
threads.message: What??? The airport card resides in the screen under the clutch cover.

threads.title: 15" Mid-2009 MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Airport Install?
threads.message: Bad connector or cable is the common problem why this does not work. Try a known good LCD assembly, 13 and 15 are the same for the airport connector.
